info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:23PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Transylvania and Pickens Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pickens. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easley, Pickens, Liberty, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Jocassee, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Table Rock State Park, Rosman, Six Mile and Gorges State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
